result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:54 AM Defendant Jake F. Groom not in court.  Attorney Taylor M Hart in court for Jake F. Groom.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Hart has no record to make.  State requests warrant and begin bond forfeiture. Default TR Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant and begin bond forfeiture.

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jake F. Groom in court.  Attorney Taylor M Hart in court for Jake F. Groom. Atty Hart does not believe matters will track.  Atty Hart received discovery and requests matter be set for preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.

2:03 PM  Defendant Jake F. Groom in court. Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Taylor Hart, 620 8th Avenue, Baraboo, WI 53913 (608) 355-2000 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month commencing September 1, 2022, directly to the Sauk Co. records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jake F. Groom in court.  Attorney Tracey A. Wood in court for Jake F. Groom.  Court states cases and appearances.  22CF347 and 22TR4269 are tracking w/21CF765 today.  Atty Hargrove states this will not be a prelim today as DE needs time to find out if he qualifies for a PD in the new case so all matters may track.  Believes the next date in 21CF765 would be a waiver of prelim.  State doesn't object to a reset.  All bonds continued.  21CF765 set for waiver of prelim.  22CF347 and 22TR4269 to track.  DE will reach out to PD's office to see if he qualifies.  DE waives his time limits for PH in 22CF347.  PTC also set for 7/15/2022 at 9:00 a.m.  All matters to track.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.

3:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jake F. Groom appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger appeared by video for Jake F. Groom.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE will be seeking private counsel. 
Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  Court advises DE has a preliminary hearing in another case and sets this matter to track to discuss future scheduling of this matter.  State recommends $800 cash bond.  Atty Getsinger updates DE's address.  Atty Getsinger recommends a signature bond.  $350.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No possession of a controlled substance without a valid Rx.
Status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
